subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: The Great Schism of 1054
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Great Schism of 1054 usable.

hook.text: One word split Christianity in two. East and West argued over a single Latin phrase and never reconciled.

buildup.text: Rome and Constantinople had drifted apart for centuries: different languages, liturgies, and political loyalties.

discovery.text: The 'filioque' clause â€” whether the Holy Spirit proceeds from the Father 'and the Son' â€” became the final straw.

twist.text: In 1054, papal legates excommunicated the Patriarch. He excommunicated them back. Christianity split permanently.

climax.text: The schism created Catholic West and Orthodox East. Nearly a millennium later, the split remains unhealed.

punchline.text: One Latin word. Two churches. A thousand years of division.

quiz.question: What triggered the Great Schism of 1054?
options: Theological disagreement about the Holy Spirit
